Package spring.ecommerce.exception

Class GlobalExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
spring.ecommerce.exception.GlobalExceptionHandler
@RestControllerAdvice public class GlobalExceptionHandler extends Object
Global exception handler for all controllers and security exceptions.

  • Method Details

    • handleGeneralException

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.Exception.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleGeneralException(Exception ex)
      Handles any unexpected errors that occur in the application.
      Parameters:
      ex - the exception
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with an error message and HTTP status 500 (Internal Server Error)

    • handleValidationExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> handleValidationExceptions(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException ex)
      Handles validation exceptions that occur when a method argument fails validation. This method processes the validation errors that occur in request bodies or query parameters, including both field-level and global errors.
      Parameters:
      ex - The MethodArgumentNotValidException thrown when validation fails. It contains the details of the validation errors.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a map of validation errors. The map contains the field names as keys and the associated error messages as values. The response will have a status of 400 Bad Request, indicating invalid input.

    • handleInternalAuthenticationServiceException

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.security.authentication.InternalAuthenticationServiceException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleInternalAuthenticationServiceException(org.springframework.security.authentication.InternalAuthenticationServiceException ex)
      Handles exceptions related to authentication service errors. This method catches InternalAuthenticationServiceException thrown during the authentication process and returns an appropriate error message.
      Parameters:
      ex - The InternalAuthenticationServiceException thrown during authentication. It contains the error message and details about the service failure.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing an error message and HTTP status 500 (Internal Server Error), indicating that there was an issue with the authentication service.

    • handleAuthenticationException

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleAuthenticationException(org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException ex)
      Handles general authentication exceptions.
      Parameters:
      ex - the authentication exception
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with an error message and HTTP status 403 (Forbidden)

    • handleExpiredJwtException

      @ExceptionHandler(io.jsonwebtoken.ExpiredJwtException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleExpiredJwtException(io.jsonwebtoken.ExpiredJwtException ex)
      Handles expired JWT token exceptions. This method catches ExpiredJwtException when a JWT token has expired and returns an appropriate error message. It also clears the security context to log out the user.
      Parameters:
      ex - The ExpiredJwtException thrown when the JWT token is expired. It contains details about the expired token.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with an error message and HTTP status 401 (Unauthorized), indicating that the session has expired and the user needs to log in again.

    • handleProductNotFoundException

      @ExceptionHandler(ProductNotFoundException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleProductNotFoundException(ProductNotFoundException ex)
      Handles ProductNotFoundException when a specified product is not found in the system. This method returns a response with the exception message and HTTP status 404 (Not Found).
      Parameters:
      ex - The ProductNotFoundException thrown when the product is not found.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with the exception message and HTTP status 404 (Not Found).

    • handleProductNotFoundException

      @ExceptionHandler(ImageUploadException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleProductNotFoundException(ImageUploadException ex)
      Handles ImageUploadException when an error occurs during the image upload process. This method returns a response with the exception message and HTTP status 500 (Internal Server Error).
      Parameters:
      ex - The ImageUploadException thrown when an error occurs during the image upload process.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with the exception message and HTTP status 500 (Internal Server Error).

    • handleBadCredentialsException

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleBadCredentialsException(org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException ex)
      Handles authentication failures, such as invalid credentials.
      Parameters:
      ex - the exception thrown during authentication
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with an error message and HTTP status 401 (Unauthorized)

    • handleProductNotFoundException

      @ExceptionHandler(UserNotFoundException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleProductNotFoundException(UserNotFoundException ex)
      Handles UserNotFoundException when a specified user is not found in the system. This method returns a response with the exception message and HTTP status 404 (Not Found).
      Parameters:
      ex - The UserNotFoundException thrown when the user is not found.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with the exception message and HTTP status 404 (Not Found).

    • handleRoleNotFoundException

      @ExceptionHandler(RoleNotFoundException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleRoleNotFoundException(RoleNotFoundException ex)
      Handles RoleNotFoundException when a specified role is not found in the system. This method returns a response with the exception message and HTTP status 404 (Not Found).
      Parameters:
      ex - The RoleNotFoundException thrown when the role is not found.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with the exception message and HTTP status 404 (Not Found).
